page.title: 13PEOPLE & TRADE PLEAN
page.content: Apart from West Plean School, school rolls have almost halved in the area during the last ten years. This has meant a reduction in staff at the East Plean primary school and the head mistress often finds herself having to teach a class. Shelterd Housing has been provided in the village of Plean to accommodate the increasing number of old people. With the opening of super markets in the towns many of the small village shops closed. There is no longer a Co-operative society in Plean. The premises have been taken over by Pakistan families who run two general stores that remain open until 9p.m. seven days a week. Postal shopping is popular in the area.
